newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Centaur raises A$34 mln by placement.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Centaur raises A$34 mln by placement.

text.p: Centaur Mining and Exploration Ltd said on Thursday it raised an additional A$34 million through the placement of 20 million shares at A$1.70 each to Australian and international institutions following a A$102 million placement on Wednesday.
Centaur said the A$34 million would also be used for the Cawse nickel/cobalt project development and construction and other working capital requirements.
The total A$136 million of placements was jointly arranged by Bell Securities Ltd and Prudential-Bache Securities (Australia) Ltd.
The Cawse nickel/cobalt project, which is in Western Australia, is expected to start operations in late 1997 and initially produce about 8,400 tonnes of nickel and 2,000 tonnes of cobalt.
Centaur has said it expects to recoup its development costs of A$176 million for the project in the first two years of operation.
Centaur is controlled by Melbourne mining entrepreneur Joseph Gutnick, who also controls Great Central Mines NL.
At 1.00 p.m. (0300 GMT), Centaur shares were three cents weaker at A$1.79.
